subject: Nutrition
title: Pellagra in the American South
description: Learn Pellagra in the American South in one minute.

hook.text: By 1915, pellagra killed 10,000 Americans a year. Doctors thought it was infectious. They were wrong.

buildup.text: Pellagra caused skin sores, diarrhea, dementia, and deathâ€”spreading through the corn-dependent South.

discovery.text: Joseph Goldberger proved it was dietary by feeding prisoners varied foodâ€”none developed pellagra.

twist.text: Southern elites resisted the nutritional explanation because it exposed the poverty of their labor system.

climax.text: Niacin enrichment of flour in the 1940s eliminated pellagra almost overnight across the nation.

punchline.text: Poverty caused the disease. Pride delayed the cure.
